column4: which file defines what services start up?  i want to stop smbd from starting.
there's no file, there's a directory: /etc/rc2.d/
those files seem to just link to scripts in /etc/init..
i see that there's a "samba".  but what file runs "samba start" on boot?
if the symlink exists in /etc/rc2.d/, it will be run.
you may wish to read up on the man pages for update-rc.d and invoke-rc.d
so if any of those symlinks exist, some startup process will run them with "start" appended?
yup.
thx
